Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Alaska Range North of Trims Camp

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 24 at 2:35PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Surf Possible At Point Hope Monday Night Into Tuesday... High surf and minor coastal flooding is possible at Point Hope Monday night into Tuesday night. There is still a significant amount of uncertainty if this will occur, but the storm approaching the West Coast on Monday will need to be watched.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 24 at 2:34PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Surf Possible Monday Into Tuesday... High surf and minor coastal flooding is possible from the Yukon Delta north to the the Bering Strait from Monday into Tuesday, and from the Bering Strait to Kivalina Monday night into Tuesday night. There is still a significant amount of uncertainty if this will occur, but the storm approaching the West Coast on Monday
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bering Strait Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Kivalina and Red Dog Dock; Shishmaref; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 24 at 2:34PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Freezing Rain Possible Over Southwest Alaska Through Saturday... There is a slight chance of freezing rain southwest of Huslia through Saturday. If freezing rain does occur amounts will be light with only a thin glaze of ice. Warm temperatures will occur in addition to the chance of freezing rain, making roads more slippery over the next several

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 24 at 2:22PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow With Periods Of Freezing Rain Through Saturday... Several inches of snow are likely along with a chance of freezing rain in the Alaska Range south of Carlo Creek and Trims Camp through Saturday. entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp; Southern Denali Borough

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 24 at 7:52PM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The Saint Johns River at Astor is forecast to continue a slow fall within Minor Flood Stage through early Saturday. River levels are then forecast to only slightly climb this weekend, primarily due to northerly winds, but remain in Minor Flood Stage.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...North Laramie Range. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST this evening.
